intro: Schismatoclada marojejyensis, commonly known as the Marojejy schismatoclada, is a rare flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters. It is adapted to the unique ecological conditions of the Marojejy Massif, a biodiversity hotspot.
